1.title: Overview
1.content: Before you begin, ensure you have: . | A valid Peer Platform user account | Appropriate permissions to access or edit documents | Any required document assets (e.g., Protocol, SAP, TLF for clinical documents) | .

2.title: Login and Dashboard
2.content: . | Log in at [your-login-url] using your credentials. | Once logged in, you’ll see the Peer Platform dashboard, showing any documents or studies assigned to you. | . Continue to Creating a New Document to learn how the Peer team sets up a new document during the “Build & Config” phase.

4.title: Build & Config Phase
4.content: In our initial rollout, the Peer team will create and configure the document for you. During this phase: . | A new study/document project is created. | Relevant document templates are chosen (e.g., CSR, Narratives, Protocol, Plain Language Summary). | Required data sources (Protocol, SAP, TLF, etc.) are uploaded and processed by the AI engine. | The system auto-generates initial content for each section of your document. | . You (the customer or medical writer) will typically begin working from the Editing and Review phase onward.

5.title: Document Types
5.content: Examples of supported document types: . | Clinical Study Report (CSR) | Narratives | Protocol | Plain Language Summary | (Add or remove based on your needs) | .

6.title: Video Demo (Placeholder)
6.content: We’ll embed a video here that shows the Peer team’s “Build & Config” process from start to finish.

7.title: Editing and Review
7.content: Once the Peer team has created the new document, you can: . | Access the Kanban or section-based view of the document | Perform Chat edits, Manual edits, or Trace to Data for verification | .

8.title: 1. Chat
8.content: Leverage our AI-powered chat interface to: . | Make quick edits or content transformations (e.g., “Convert this text to a table”) | Insert key messages or additional paragraphs | Get suggestions to refine language or structure | . Use Case #1 . Placeholder: “Video demonstrating how to convert a prose paragraph to an in-text table via the chat interface.” . Use Case #2 . Placeholder: “Video demonstrating how to insert a key message from the clinical team using the chat interface.” . Use Case #3 . Placeholder: “Video showing how to summarize or rephrase a large section of text with a single command.” . Use Case #4 . Placeholder: “Video showing how to restore previous versions or compare changes in real time.” .

9.title: 2. Manual Edit
9.content: For direct, on-screen editing—like adjusting spelling, formatting, or quick text fixes—just click into the text area: . | Make your edits | See optional redline/tracking or revert changes | Confirm when you’re done | .

10.title: 3. Trace to Data
10.content: To ensure accuracy, you can: . | Click “Trace to Data” next to any section | View the original data sources (protocol, SAP, TLF, etc.) used by the AI | Cross-check for correctness before finalizing | .

11.title: Export and Finalization
11.content: When your document is fully reviewed and approved: . | Apply Abbreviations & Hyperlinks The AI automatically checks for abbreviations and relevant hyperlinks. | Final Consistency Check Ensures the document is consistent with the source data, final redlines are accepted (or rejected), and the final layout is correct. | Export . | Download as .docx (Word format) | (Possible future formats: PDF, HTML, etc.) | . | . After export, you can open the final Word document to: . | Perform any last-minute formatting touches | Share with regulatory authorities, clients, or other stakeholders | .

12.title: Frequently Asked Questions
12.content: Q1: Which document types are supported by Peer Platform? . A1: We currently support CSR, Narratives, Protocols, Plain Language Summaries, and more. For specialized formats, contact Peer support. Q2: How do I revert to a previous version of a section? . A2: Use the version history or “redline” functionality in the Editing and Review phase to compare or restore an older version. Q3: Can I add a custom template? . A3: Yes. Please reach out to the Peer team during the Build & Config phase to incorporate a custom template into the AI engine. (Add more FAQs as you gather user feedback.) .

14.title: Peer Platform Documentation
14.content: Welcome to the Peer Platform documentation site! . Our platform empowers teams to: . | Create and configure new medical/clinical documents (e.g., CSR, Narratives, Protocols, Plain Language Summaries, etc.) | Build & Configure documents (done by the Peer team initially) | Allow customers and medical writers to edit and review using advanced AI-assisted features (chat-based editing, manual edits, and data traceability) | Finalize and export the completed documents in multiple formats | .

15.title: Quick Navigation
15.content: . | Getting Started | Creating a New Document | Editing and Review | Export and Finalization | FAQ | .

16.title: Using This Documentation
16.content: . | Set Up Learn basic requirements and log in to the platform in Getting Started. | Create New Documents Understand the initial “Build & Config” phase (handled by Peer) and see how to add your data sources in Creating a New Document. | Edit and Review Explore the powerful AI-assisted editing tools, chat workflows, and more in Editing and Review. | Finalize Learn how to export your finished document (with auto-inserted hyperlinks and abbreviations) in Export and Finalization. | Get Answers Refer to the FAQ or contact our support team. | .
